Package MyFarm

Class FarmLot

java.lang.Object
MyFarm.FarmLot
public class FarmLot extends Object
The Farm lot object represents a single field/lot This lot can grow a single object

    void
    ageLot()
    Ages the FarmLot and its crop by one day.
    String
    buySeed(Player player, String cropName)
    Checks if player can buy and plant a seed on the current lot If player is able to plant, the lot would contain the desired species of crop In exchange, the player will spend the appropriate amount of coins.

    checkStatus()
    Checks whether the crop would wither or is ready to harvest

    dig(Player player)
    Checks if player can use his shovel on the current lot If player is able to dig, the player will gain experience and would remove the withered crop inside the lot.

    displayLot()
    This function returns the name of the image that the current lot should be displaying
    String
    fertilizeCrop(Player player)
    Checks if player can use his fertilize the current lot If player is able to fertilize, the player will gain experience The crop of the current lot would have its fertilizer level increased Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
    String
    getOccupancy()
    This is the getter method for the occupancy attribute
    String
    harvestCrop(Player player)
    Checks if player can harvest a crop in the current lot If player is able to harvest, the player will gain experience and coins according to the crop species The lot would become empty afterward Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
    String
    inform()
    Displays the information of the current lot, through a string The String also includes HTML styling This function is meant to be called by the setText() function of the selectedLabel JLabel in the FarmFrame class

    Returns the status of the crop whether it has withered or not

    Checks if player can use his watering can on the current lot If player is able to water the lot, the player will gain experience The crop of the current lot would have its water level increased Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class

  • Constructor Details

    • FarmLot

      public FarmLot()
      The constructor of Farmlot. The default starting settings, which is an empty unplowed lot

  • Method Details

    • plow

      public String plow(Player player)
      Checks if player can plow the current lot If player is able to plow, the player will gain experience Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the plow action

    • mine

      public String mine(Player player)
      Checks if player can use his pickaxe on the current lot If player is able to mine, the player will gain experience and would destroy the rock inside the lot. In exchange, the player will spend 50 coins. Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the mine action

    • dig

      public String dig(Player player)
      Checks if player can use his shovel on the current lot If player is able to dig, the player will gain experience and would remove the withered crop inside the lot. In exchange, the player will spend 7 coins. Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the dig action

    • buySeed

      public String buySeed(Player player, String cropName)
      Checks if player can buy and plant a seed on the current lot If player is able to plant, the lot would contain the desired species of crop In exchange, the player will spend the appropriate amount of coins. Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      cropName - species name of crop to be planted
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the buying and planting the seed

    • waterCrop

      public String waterCrop(Player player)
      Checks if player can use his watering can on the current lot If player is able to water the lot, the player will gain experience The crop of the current lot would have its water level increased Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the water action

    • fertilizeCrop

      public String fertilizeCrop(Player player)
      Checks if player can use his fertilize the current lot If player is able to fertilize, the player will gain experience The crop of the current lot would have its fertilizer level increased Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the fertilize action

    • harvestCrop

      public String harvestCrop(Player player)
      Checks if player can harvest a crop in the current lot If player is able to harvest, the player will gain experience and coins according to the crop species The lot would become empty afterward Displays the success of the action through a String The String also includes HTML styling String returned is intended to be received by the addNotif() function that is found in the FarmFrame class
      Parameters:
      player - given Player
      Returns:
      in String form, the success or failure of the harvest action

    • ageLot

      public void ageLot()
      Ages the FarmLot and its crop by one day.

    • checkStatus

      public char checkStatus()
      Checks whether the crop would wither or is ready to harvest
      Returns:
      character representing the Crop's status

    • inform

      public String inform()
      Displays the information of the current lot, through a string The String also includes HTML styling This function is meant to be called by the setText() function of the selectedLabel JLabel in the FarmFrame class
      Returns:
      crucial information about the current lot

    • setOccupancy

      public void setOccupancy(String occupancy)
      Changes the status of what is occupying the Lot
      Parameters:
      occupancy - Empty, Rock, or Crop

    • getOccupancy

      public String getOccupancy()
      This is the getter method for the occupancy attribute
      Returns:
      The given occupancy in String form

    • isItWithered

      public boolean isItWithered()
      Returns the status of the crop whether it has withered or not
      Returns:
      true or false about its withered status

    • setCrop

      public void setCrop(String name)
      The setter function for the crop object attribute in the FarmLot
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the species of the crop

    • displayLot

      public String displayLot()
      This function returns the name of the image that the current lot should be displaying
      Returns:
